results.title: Amanda Seyfried Finally Stakes Her Claim
results.abstract: The “Mean Girls” and “Mamma Mia!” actress knows her performance as Marion Davies in“Mank” will be a turning point in her career. But first, she had to put some distance between herself and Hollywood.

results.title: Some Movies Actually Understand Poverty in America
results.abstract: The complex realities of subsistence escape “Hillbilly Elegy.” But as far back as Charlie Chaplin’s “City Lights,” filmmakers have been turning a discerning eye on destitution.

results.title: Latinos, Long Dismissed in Hollywood, Push to Make Voices Heard
results.abstract: To many Latinos in Hollywood, every gain seems to be followed by a setback. The writer Tanya Saracho and others involved in the Untitled Latinx Project want to change that.
